basics.name: Fabio Paolizzo
basics.label: AI Lead Researcher and Systems Architect
basics.summary: An AI Researcher and Systems Architect with a primary focus on Quantitative Finance. I develop novel, uncorrelated alpha by designing and deploying proprietary trading systems that model complex human behavior and value perception in financial markets. My approach is built on a unique combination of deep, long-term experience: 30 years of hands-on systems architecture, 25 years of leadership in grant-funded AI, and 5 years of R&D architecting a proprietary, alpha-generating trading ecosystem for the live market validation of novel AI models.

work.name: Self-Directed
work.position: Independent Quantitative Research & Systems Development, Quantitative Trading
work.summary: Designed and developed a proprietary trading ecosystem from the ground up to research and deploy alpha-generating strategies based on novel AI models.
highlights: Engineered a production-validated research pipeline that generates statistically robust, mid-frequency alpha from market data, serving as the framework for integrating complex, human-generated data.
Pioneering the integration of high-dimensional, unstructured data sources (news-flow, social media sentiment) to generate uncorrelated alpha.
Engineered and deployed a robust, end-to-end trading system featuring a high-performance backtesting engine and an automated execution module with robust API integration.
Designed the entire system with first principles for horizontal scaling, ensuring compatibility with large-scale, distributed cluster-computing environments.

work.name: University of Palermo, Dept. of Computer Engineering
work.position: Consultant, Large Language Models & Knowledge Graphs
work.summary: Advise an EU-funded project (MUSIC4D) on architecting and integrating Large Language Models and Knowledge Graphs for the analysis of complex, multi-modal data.

work.name: Occidental College, Los Angeles
work.position: Postdoctoral Mellon Fellow, AI, Cognitive Science & Computational Arts
work.summary: Held a postdoctoral fellowship in the Dept. of Computer Science, Dept of Cognitive Science and Dept. of Music.
highlights: Spearheaded and curated high-profile academic conferences, including a symposium on the sonification of complex scientific data featuring a scientist from NASA's JPL.
Authored and delivered new graduate and undergraduate curricula in 'Music & AI' and 'Audio Signal Processing'.
Mentored top-performing students in applied AI and HCI, receiving formal recognition from the Fulbright Program for contributing to a successful student award.
Released ‘Medusae’, a practice-based case study in valuing real-time human-machine creative collaboration.

work.name: University of Rome Tor Vergata, Dept. of Electronic Engineering
work.position: Scientific Coordinator & Marie Curie Principal Investigator
work.summary: Led multiple large-scale, EU-funded research programs focused on modeling complex, unstructured data using advanced AI.
highlights: Served as Principal Investigator for MUSICAL-MOODS, a €244K project funded by a Marie Sklodowska-Curie Global Fellowship.
Architected and led the 'AI MUSE' proposal, a nearly €4 million H2020 research program rated 'Excellent' by the European Commission.
Served as PI and Scientific Coordinator for a consortium of 11 elite academic and industry partners across 8 countries.
Pioneered the use of multi-kernel deep learning, semantic graphs, and NLP/sentiment analysis to model emergent behavior.
Managed the nearly €3.5 million PRO-MUSE proposal, which was rated as 'high-quality' by the EC.

work.name: VIVOflip (Startup Venture)
work.summary: Founded and led a startup developing novel interactive systems for museum installations.
highlights: Architected a gesture-controlled interactive system using computer vision, which was acquired for permanent installation by the National Academy of San Luca.
Led the venture's commercialization strategy and played a principal role in securing EU Regional Development funding.

courses: Doctoral research involved architecting and developing 'VIVO,' an autonomous, interactive AI system to model emergent creative behavior and human-machine self-attention methods, establishing the formal methodology now applied to modeling agent behavior in financial markets.

education.institution: University of Rome Tor Vergata, Italy
courses: Advanced training in applied Machine Learning, including Music Information Retrieval (MIR) and Digital Signal Processing (DSP).

publications.name: A New Multilabel System for Automatic Music Emotion Recognition
publications.publisher: Proc. of 2021 IEEE International Workshop on Metrology for Industry 4.0 & IoT
publications.summary: Designed and validated a novel machine learning system for quantifying subjective emotional responses to music, solving a core challenge in modeling non-traditional data sources.

publications.name: Creative Autonomy in a Simple Interactive Music System
publications.summary: Formalized a model of computational autonomy, demonstrating a method for analyzing emergent creative behavior in complex systems.

projects.name: Musical-Moods Dataset
projects.summary: A large-scale, multimodal dataset (audio, video, text, mocap) for training AI models on complex, subjective human data. The primary outcome of a major EU-funded MSCA Global Fellowship.

projects.name: VIVO (Video Interactive VST Orchestra) System
projects.summary: An intelligent, interactive AI system developed over two decades, serving as the primary R&D platform for modeling emergent novelty. Implements real-time data processing, automated feature engineering, and pattern recognition using constrained Markov Chains.
highlights: Foundational for current work on market data patterns
